forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind 14 to 36 mph, with gusts as high as 54 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 45, with temperatures rising to around 47 overnight. Southwest wind 14 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, today unfolds under a heavy quilt of clouds, where the air hums with anticipation of rain and the distant rumble of thunder. As you look towards the iconic silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge, it stands shrouded in a low marine layer, softening its edges and blending it gently into the backdrop of a somber sky. This day evokes a mood that feels introspective, yet electric, with gusty winds whispering stories in every gust. Those moving through the city are met with a coolness that bites at exposed skin, a reminder of nature’s presence as the temperatures trend downward.

Expect showers that will weave in and out of existence, punctuated by the occasional crack of thunder, as the afternoon progresses. The drizzle may dance lightly before becoming a more earnest embrace, so an umbrella and waterproof outer layer are your trusty companions for the day. Despite the chill, this weather invites cozy ventures—a chance to explore the hidden treasures of local cafes, tucked away galleries, or perhaps a quiet corner in a bookstore where you can lose yourself among the pages as the rain provides a sonorous backdrop. In the hustle of urban life, there is beauty to be found even in the storm.
